export_format.description: Database table export of all EHI. Documentation describes 1,466 database tables with column-level detail. The actual export produces raw database table data (column types are int, varchar, datetime, etc.) plus a separate folder of scanned documents. Exact file format (CSV, SQL, etc.) of the table data is not specified in the documentation. The note about SSN presence suggests raw unredacted data.

clinical.evidence: Extensive clinical tables: allergies, diagnosis, problemlist, immunizations, vitals, labdata, labdatadetail, rxhub_rxhistory, progressnotes, hpi, physicalexam, surgicalhistory, medicalhistory, flowsheets, careplan, plus dozens of specialty-specific tables (dermatology, ophthalmology, audiology, OB, behavioral health, dental, vascular, etc.)

secure_messages.evidence: tblwebmsg ('messages sent or received to and from the Patient Portal'), tblportalmsg ('messages related to Web Encounters'), tblportalcontacts, tblportalusers, emaillogs ('metadata of all successful emails sent by Messenger Campaigns'), smsmsglogs, voicemsglogs, paging_details, emessagelogs, careplan_messageboard

billing_financial.evidence: billingdata ('patient billing related items to an encounter'), enc_billingdata, enc_claimdata, claim_actions, claimstatus, claimlevelinfo, claimrefund, adjustmentposting, edi_invoice, edi_payments ('EDI payments including patient and insurance payment'), edi_paymentdetail, edi_inv_cpt, edi_inv_diagnosis, edi_inv_adjustments, edi_inv_eob, refunds, refunddetail, refundposting, paymentplan* (8 tables), costestimate* tables, collectionmanagement, credtransaction, statements_pdfs, eptstmts, lockbox_discrete_data, commissionrpt

insurance_coverage.evidence: insurance (166 columns), insurancedetail, case_insurances, eligibility* (3 tables), edi_278transactiondata, edi_278_cpt, edi_278_servicelevel, edi_serviceauthorizations, prior_authorisation_status, patient_dental_insplan_benefits, insurance_dental_insplan_category, echeckininsuranceinfo, vision_eligibility* (6 tables), ins_payer_mix

appointments_scheduling.evidence: appt_misc, appt_misc_billsummary, apptblocks, apptbuffer, apptrecurrencemapping, apptrecurrenceweeklypattern, apptreminder, enc ('encounter and related information which acts as primary data'), encounters, enc_multiappt, visitcodes, visitstscodes, bumplist, patientwaitlist, waitlistlogs, kioskcheckedinenc, telemed_appt_conversation, duetoday_* tables

documents_images.evidence: document ('document relationship to patient identifier, staff, provider, and physical path of the file'), imagingstudies, pnattachments, labattachment_archive, devicefiles, ihe_document, biometricimage, progressnotesattachments, proceduresattachments, dentaldocument, lsm_actionattachment, emrreferralattachments, ref_attachments, ecgreports, holterreports, spiroreports. Index page also notes: 'Scanned documents are included in a separate folder apart from the database tables.'

audit_trails.evidence: fhir_user_audit_log ('audit logs of user actions related to FHIR resources'), fhir_audit_action_type, fhir_write_back_audit_request, fhir_write_back_audit_request_detail, viewpatientallergylogs, documentbreakglass, empi_btgreasons_log, reviewlog, bh_reviewlog, trackingboard_cycletime

downloaded_files.curl_command: wget -q --no-clobber -P tables/ -i full_urls.txt --header='User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0' (see collection-log.md for full procedure)

issues: No sample export files provided — actual export file format (CSV, delimited, SQL dump, etc.) is not explicitly stated
No developer guide or documentation on how to process the exported data
The documentation mentions 'scanned documents in a separate folder' but no further detail on document export format or structure
SSN and other sensitive PII included in export without automatic redaction — documentation warns to 'carefully review and exclude before sharing'
summary: eClinicalWorks provides exceptionally comprehensive EHI export documentation via a dedicated subdomain with 1,466 database table definitions covering 21,023 columns. The documentation is a genuine database schema dump — not FHIR re-export — covering clinical data, billing/claims, insurance, appointments, portal messages, documents, and audit trails. Every table has field-level detail with column names, data types, and descriptions. This is one of the most thorough EHI export documentation sets among certified EHR vendors, both in breadth (covering highly specialized domains like dental, dermatology, ophthalmology, audiology, OB, behavioral health, correctional health, and ASC/anesthesia) and depth (column-level descriptions with foreign key references). The main gap is the absence of sample export files or a developer guide.
